revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Crustacean Hairs
tldr: This study investigates the structure and functions of the hairs on crustaceans, particularly their role in transmitting external sensations to the internal sensitive parts. The author, Campbell De Morgan, examines the anatomical connections between the hairs and the shell, as well as the relationship with the inner vascular and nervous layer of the integument. The findings suggest that crustacean hairs may serve as tactile organs, allowing the animals to sense their environment.
